result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian W. Creamer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: sentence deft is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Full time employment of at least 30 hours per week, or if not, perform nine hours of community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.
Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: sentence deft is currently serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Transcript of Sentencing Hearing
Judge Jacobson
Jan. 31st, 2018
Associated with Charge #1
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:13 pm 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Nick Carroll. 
No additions/corrections to PSI. No witnesses. 
Argument. 
Def makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: 4.5 years imprisonment - 1.5 years IC and 3 years ES - CONDITIONS OF ES>>repayment of fine of $2452 inclusive; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; fulltime employment of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; 3 years dl revocation; 3 years IID; 6 pts against dl. 
COURT ORDERS sentence to run CONSECUTIVE to sentence deft is currently serving. 
COURT finds the deft entitled to 1 day sentence credit. 
COURT finds the deft eligible for SAP and NOT eligible for CIP. 
COURT allows parties to retain copies of PSI and reminds them to maintain their confidentiality. 
COURT does NOT order DNA sample. 
Adj: 2:37 pm
ad Prosequendum
re Writ
